s1: Real-world data are commonly messy, distributed, and heterogeneous.
s2: Communicate a cyber security situation and response to a heterogenous team of professionals.

s1: This course introduces core concepts of data cleaning, standardisation, and data integration, that are aimed at converting and mapping raw data into other formats that allow more efficient and convenient use and analysis of data. The courses also discusses data quality, management, and storage issues as relevant to data analytics.
s2: Students will also learn and exercise handling of an existing intrusion which includes forensic operations as well as securing the remaining systems.

s1: Critically reflect upon different data sources, types, formats and structures.
s2: Define and identify defensive cyber security architectures and their purpose.

s1: Justify and apply data cleaning, preprocessing, and standardisation for data analytics.
s2: Defensive Cyber Security operations introduces and exercises a complete range of anomaly / intrusion detection and identification mechanisms.

s1: Apply data integration concepts and techniques to heterogeneous and distributed data.
s2: Communicate a cyber security situation and response to a heterogenous team of professionals.

s1: Interpret, assess and discuss data quality measurements.
s2: Define and identify defensive cyber security architectures and their purpose.

s1: Understand and be able to use advanced data wrangling, data integration, and database techniques as relevant to data analytics.
s2: Defensive Cyber Security operations introduces and exercises a complete range of anomaly / intrusion detection and identification mechanisms.
